dji.sdk.api.GroundStation

Class DJIGroundStationTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • dji.sdk.api.GroundStation.DJIGroundStationTask

  • public class DJIGroundStationTask
extends java.lang.Object

    Dji Ground Station Task Define Class

    The ground station task will determine the way point the drone will reach. Specifically, only 16 way points could be added for Phantom 2 series. However, Inspire 1 and Phantom 3 series allow 99 way points mission.
    Version:
    V2.1.0
    Author:
    DJI Software

    • Field Detail

      • wayPointCount

        public int wayPointCount
        The count of way ponints. The value of this parameter represents the count of way points in the Arraylist of Tasks.

      • startWaypointIndex

        public int startWaypointIndex
        The start way point index is the index of the first executed way point. By adjusting this parameters, you could control which task will be executed in the next step.

      • mWaypointsList

        public java.util.ArrayList<DJIGroundStationWaypoint> mWaypointsList
        This array list is a cache of missions, the waypoints. They are a series of positions which the aircraft will reach.

      • isLoop

        public boolean isLoop
        This parameter will determine whether execute the ground station tasks repeatedly. In other words, while the drone completes the last waypoint action, it will immediately head to the 1st waypoint.

      • repeatNum

        public int repeatNum
        Using this parameter will determine how many times the waypoint task will be executed. When the execution time is larger than 1, the drone will go to the first waypoint and repeat the whole task after accomplishing the last waypoint action. When the task is redone the required times, the drone will execute the action set by finishAction.

      • movingMode

        public DJIGroundStationTypeDef.DJIGroundStationMovingMode movingMode
        Only supported by the Inspire 1 and Phantom3. Determine which kind of heading mode the drone will take from one waypoint to next waypoint. The default is GSHeadingTowardNextWaypoint.

      • finishAction

        public DJIGroundStationTypeDef.DJIGroundStationFinishAction finishAction
        It will determine the action for drone when the waypoint task is finished. There are 4 kinds of actions defined in DJIGroundStationFinishAction. The default is nothing will happen. This is not supported by P2V and P2V+.

      • pathMode

        public DJIGroundStationTypeDef.DJIGroundStationPathMode pathMode
        Only supported by the Inspire 1 and Phantom3. The path mode will determine the drone's path from one waypoint to next waypoint. The default is Point_To_Point mode, i.e., straight from one waypoint to next waypoint

      • liftingMaxSpeed

        public float liftingMaxSpeed
        The maximum speed for drone's lifting vertically during the waypoint task. The unit is m/s. The maximum available value is 5.0m/s. This is not supported by P2V and P2V+.

      • horizontalMaxSpeed

        public float horizontalMaxSpeed
        The maximum speed for drone's moving horizontally. The unit is m/s. The maximum available value is 7.0m/s. This is not supported by P2V and P2V+. During the waypoint task, users can adjust the horizontal speed among -7.0m/s and 7.0m/s through remote controller.

      • yawMaxSpeed

        public float yawMaxSpeed
        The maximum angular speed for drone's yaw. The unit is degree/s. The maximum available value is 180.0degree/s.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DJIGroundStationTask

        public DJIGroundStationTask()
        Constructor Function

    • Method Detail

      • getWayPointCount

        public int getWayPointCount()
        Get the count of waypoint
        Returns:
        int The number of way points in the list.

      • getStartWaypointIndex

        public int getStartWaypointIndex()
        Get the start waypoint index
        Returns:
        int The index of next start way point.

      • setStartWaypointIndex

        public void setStartWaypointIndex(int index)
        Set the start waypoint index. You could use this function to adjust the sequence of way points list, to rollback to a previous way point or to execute one of the way points in the follow-up waypoints.
        Parameters:
        index - The start waypoint index

      • setLoop

        public void setLoop(boolean loop)
        Set the loop mode. If you want to execute the way points list repeatedly, this function could provide a command for setting this behavior.
        Parameters:
        loop - true for executing loop model and false for normal model.

      • addWaypoint

        public void addWaypoint(DJIGroundStationWaypoint waypoint)
        Add a wayoint to list. The additional waypoint will be put in the tail of the array list.
        Parameters:
        waypoint - The waypoint which will be added to the last of the list.

      • insertWaypoint

        public void insertWaypoint(DJIGroundStationWaypoint waypoint,
                           int index)
        Insert a waypoint. You could insert a waypoint behind the indexed waypoint.
        Parameters:
        waypoint - The inserting waypoint
        index - The index of insertion waypoint

      • RemoveAllWaypoint

        public void RemoveAllWaypoint()
        Remove all waypoint

      • removeWaypointAtIndex

        public void removeWaypointAtIndex(int index)
        Description : the input parameter is an index of the waypoint which developer want to removed from the way point list. Please make sure that the index is less than the size of the waypoint list.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the way point which will be removed from the waypointList

      • getWaypointAtIndex

        public DJIGroundStationWaypoint getWaypointAtIndex(int index)
        Get waypoint at index
        Parameters:
        index - The target waypoint index
        Returns:
        DJIGroundStationWaypoint index-th waypoint.

      • getAllWaypoint

        public java.util.ArrayList<DJIGroundStationWaypoint> getAllWaypoint()
        Get all waypoints
        Returns:
        ArrayList
